Pre-Game Insights: Montenegro began their UEFA Nations League campaign with a 2-0 defeat to Iceland on Friday. That was the third straight defeat for Robert Prosineckiâ€™s men, who have found things a little difficult lately.
Wales also failed to win last time out as they were held to a 0-0 draw at home by Turkiye.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Montenegro often do their best work at home and should have the upper hand over Wales, who tend to be poor travelers.
Wales have struggled on their travels, winning just once in their last 10 away matches.
Others: The bookies favor Wales slightly, with odds of 11/8 for a win, while Montenegro is valued at 2/1.
Steven Jovetic remains a vital player for Montenegro and has found the net in five of the last 10 international matches.
Kieffer Moore often features in attack for Wales and will be tasked with providing the cutting edge in front of goal.
